slides.title: Percentage
slides.content:
**Formula:** (Part/Whole) × 100
*Example:* 25 out of 200 = (25/200) × 100 = 12.5%

**Increase/Decrease:**
New - Old / Old × 100

**Quick Conversions:**
1/2 = 50%, 1/4 = 25%, 1/5 = 20%

slides.title: Profit & Loss
slides.content:
**Profit = SP - CP** (Selling - Cost Price)
**Loss = CP - SP**

**Profit % = (Profit/CP) × 100**
**Loss % = (Loss/CP) × 100**

**Discount = Marked Price - Selling Price**

slides.title: Simple & Compound Interest
slides.content:
**Simple Interest:** SI = (P × R × T) / 100
*P=Principal, R=Rate%, T=Time*

**Amount = P + SI**

**Compound Interest:** A = P(1 + R/100)^T
*CI = A - P*

question.questionText: A shopkeeper buys an item for ₹500 and sells it for ₹600. What is the profit percentage?
